meanings.definition: To move (troops or equipment) into position for military action.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers deployed to the battlefield at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The army deployed their tanks along the border.
meanings.sent3: The troops deployed swiftly, surprising the enemy.
meanings.sent4: Like chess pieces on a board, the military deployed their forces strategically.
meanings.sent5: The image of the troops being deployed is etched in my mind.

meanings.sent1: The firefighters deployed their hoses to extinguish the flames.
meanings.sent2: The manager deployed a new strategy to increase sales.
meanings.sent3: The team deployed their skills to solve the problem.
meanings.sent4: She deployed her charm to win over the audience.
meanings.sent5: The superhero deployed his powers to save the city.

meanings.sent1: The seeds were deployed across the field for optimal growth.
meanings.sent2: The company deployed its resources to expand into new markets.
meanings.sent3: The students deployed themselves around the library to study.
meanings.sent4: The dancers deployed gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The plan was to deploy the team members effectively for the project.
